<@UJD104QDR> I know HubSpot has their own settings to display a cookie consent banner but I am not looking to use their's. OneTrust is an alternative that can be used by setting their script on the headers for each HubSpot page, and I need to find out how to disable/enable HubSpot cookies using a javascript function

not possible at the moment.
• large database workaround: export as csv, reorder in csv, then reimport
• small database workaround: provide an order column and in your template use that to order your data via query params

I asked to know how to help you in depth, but the idea is:
Define in the head (not header) of your templates a dictionary, then you should br able to fill it from anywhere with {% do var.append %}
And finally loop it and print it next to the built in classes :)
(on my mobile, so can't provide code examples right now)

nice! I like that solution. One thing I ended up doing was printing a value from a module in the body classes <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/export-to-template-context#retrieving-parameters-from-modules-already-rendered-on-the-template|via this solution>
